body_html:
I think you can probably get started right now implementing the file_system.h API -- there is a private internal library in python that currently already binds to the C++ implementation, but we have not yet exposed it until we can completely replace all of the existing uses. By the time you probably get all of the C++ components done, I'm optimistic that the python support will be there too.

Which DFS are you working on, and where were you planning on hosting the code, btw? Alternative implementations of the file_system implementations should be a matter of building and linking a shared library, but we haven't yet tried this ourselves (currently we host and support all of the file system implementations, but we probably won't do this for all filesystems).

body:
I think you can probably get started right now implementing the file_system.h API -- there is a private internal library in python that currently already binds to the C++ implementation, but we have not yet exposed it until we can completely replace all of the existing uses.  By the time you probably get all of the C++ components done, I'm optimistic that the python support will be there too.

Which DFS are you working on, and where were you planning on hosting the code, btw?  Alternative implementations of the file_system implementations should be a matter of building and linking a shared library, but we haven't yet tried this ourselves (currently we host and support all of the file system implementations, but we probably won't do this for all filesystems).
